paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: The paper discusses the KCNH2 gene and reports on the variant p.T1019PfsX38, including its clinical significance, penetrance data, and functional studies.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: This mutation caused a prolonged corrected QT (QTc) interval (>570 ms) in a 5 years old girl who was homozygote for this mutation.
Heterozygote individuals had borderline QTc intervals.

functional_data.summary: The T1019PfsX38 variant modifies the long C-tail of hERG, affecting channel gating dynamics and contributing to the pathology seen in affected LQT2 patients.

variants.segregation_data: The variant was identified in an extended family of LQT2 from Oman.
variants.additional_notes: The variant was functionally characterized, showing significant effects on channel activity.
key_quotes: This mutation caused a prolonged corrected QT (QTc) interval (>570 ms) in a 5 years old girl who was homozygote for this mutation.
Heterozygote individuals had borderline QTc intervals.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the KCNH2 variant was successfully extracted.
